intro: Allamanda parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically bright yellow. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of fragrant blooms during the warmer months. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for tropical gardens. Allamanda parviflora is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
